definition:
The scalar form of *Laplace’s equation* is the partial differential
equation $${\nabla}^2f = 0$$ and the vector form is
$${\nabla}^2{\mathbf{A}}= 0,$$where ${\nabla}^2$ is the Laplacian. It is
a special case of the Helmholtz differential equation with $k = 0.$

A function $f$ which satisfies Laplace’s equation is said to be
*harmonic*. Since Laplace’s equation is linear, the superposition of any
two solutions is also a solution.
